perturbation.original_text: 4.2.2	You shall pay to us a franchise sales royalty fee (the “Franchise Sales Royalty Fee”) for each Unit Franchise you sell in the Master Territory as follows: twenty-five percent (25%) of the initial franchise fee collected from each Unit Franchisee upon execution of the Unit Franchisee’s Franchise Agreement (a “Unit Franchise Agreement”); provided, however, that if you elect to discount or reduce an initial franchise fee for any reason, the Franchise Sales Royalty Fee shall be payable to us as if the full initial franchise fee had been paid. The Franchise Sales Royalty Fee shall be paid by you to us at the same time and in the same manner as the Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee provided in Section 4.2.1 above. Any Royalty Fee you collect from the Franchisee shall be immediately paid to Us, but no later than the fifteen (15 th ) day of each calendar month. A Unit Franchise shall be deemed to be sold to a Unit Franchisee on the date that you and the Unit Franchisee execute the Unit Franchise Agreement, irrespective of when the Unit Franchise begins operation. Fees and Royalties cannot be increased or decreased without our prior written consent.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2.2	You shall pay to us a franchise sales royalty fee (the “Franchise Sales Royalty Fee”) for each Unit Franchise you sell in the Master Territory as follows: twenty-five percent (25%) of the initial franchise fee collected from each Unit Franchisee upon execution of the Unit Franchisee’s Franchise Agreement (a “Unit Franchise Agreement”); provided, however, that if you elect to discount or reduce an initial franchise fee for any reason, the Franchise Sales Royalty Fee will be subject to review and adjustment based on our assessment of the circumstances. The Franchise Sales Royalty Fee shall be paid by you to us at the same time and in the same manner as the Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee provided in Section 4.2.1 above. Any Royalty Fee you collect from the Franchisee may be retained by you, until such point as the Unit Franchise begins operation. A Unit Franchise shall be deemed to be sold to a Unit Franchisee when the Unit Franchise begins operation. Fees and Royalties can be adjusted at our discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandated that if a discounted franchise fee is used, the Franchisee is still required to pay the full fee. In the modified version, fees can be adjusted at the company's discretion. The original text said a franchise is deemed to be sold to a Unit Franchisee on the date that you and the Unit Franchisee execute the Unit Franchise Agreement, irrespective of when the Unit Franchise begins operation. The modified text says a franchise is deemed to be sold to a Unit Franchisee when the Unit Franchise begins operation. Furthermore, the original text said fees and royalties cannot be increased or decreased without prior written consent; the modified text says fees and royalties can be adjusted at our discretion. These modifications lead to an in-text contradiction and creates uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
5.15 Policies and Procedures

You shall not have the right to establish policies and/or procedures pertaining to the operation of the Franchised Business to protect the Proprietary Marks and our goodwill in the industry outside of the policies and/or procedures that we designate. You and all Unit Franchisees subject to the license granted under this Agreement shall be bound by our policies and/or procedures upon receipt of the same.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.15 Policies and Procedures

You have the right to suggest policies and/or procedures pertaining to the operation of the Franchised Business to protect the Proprietary Marks and our goodwill in the industry outside of the policies and/or procedures that we designate, but you may not establish such policies yourself. You and all Unit Franchisees subject to the license granted under this Agreement shall be bound by our policies and/or procedures, which may or may not include the suggestions made by you.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that the Franchisee does not have the right to establish policies pertaining to the operation of the Franchised Business to protect the Proprietary Marks and goodwill. The modified version says the Franchisee does have the right to suggest policies pertaining to the operation of the Franchised Business to protect the Proprietary Marks and goodwill. This creates a contradiction, since the first sentence states the Franchisee does not have the right to establish policies, but the subsequent sentences imply they can suggest policies. This modification could cause uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
10.6	Termination of this Agreement by You

You shall have no right to terminate this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
10.6 Termination of this Agreement by You

You may petition to terminate this agreement under extenuating circumstances, subject to franchisor approval.
perturbation.explanation: The original text says you shall have no right to terminate this agreement. The modified text says you may petition to terminate this agreement under extenuating circumstances. This creates a contradiction, since the first sentence states you cannot terminate the contract, but the subsequent sentence implies you may petition to terminate it under extenuating circumstances. This modification could cause uncertainty in enforcement.
